titles.title: Kyoukai no Rinne (2016)
境界のRINNE (2016)
Rin-ne: Season 2
Rinne 2
境界的轮回 第二季

anime.description: * Based on shounen manga series written and illustrated by http://anidb.net/cr818 [Takahashi Rumiko]. The adventure of Sakura Mamiya, who has the power to see ghosts after a childhood incident, and her classmate, Rinne Rokudo, who is half shinigami and helps lost spirits pass on to be reincarnated. Source: crunchyroll

tag.name: shounen
tag.description: In the context of manga and associated media, shounen, literally meaning "youth" and often also specifically "boy", refers to a male audience roughly between the ages of 10 and 18. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: target audience
tag.description: Anime, like everything else in the modern world, is targeted towards specific audiences, both implicitly by the creators and overtly by the marketing. While categories are associated with specific sex and age groups, this is not a bar on the anime being enjoyed by people who don`t fit into that band; not only do crossover titles exist, but the categories also have a considerable following outside their main demographic, and a person might as well enjoy anime from all categories. Still, does not invalidate the usefulness of marking a title as one of the categories; the same themes will likely be treated differently in anime geared for different audiences. Only one should not jump the gun and assume that a title will be more or less serious or present content in this or that way due to its target audience, or conversely assume the target audience on the content and its presentation alone. As such, the audience categories help form a broad impression of how a title might work with the announced themes, but offer little to no in-depth information about specific content or its treatment. The audience categories originate from manga magazines, which group titles of a same intended audience into a magazine that is advertised as belonging to that category, and so manga-based anime will have the category from their parent work. As for anime based on other works, the audience is often debatable, but comparing information such as time slot to the manga-based anime generally helps figure out the most likely possibility. If the parent material was classified under multiple audiences over time (for example, it was originally shounen, but then as the plot changed and became more mature, it was reclassified as seinen), and the anime adapts parent material time periods covering multiple audiences, we tag all audiences covered by the anime adaptation.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: manga
tag.description: Manga is the lifeblood that drives the anime industry. Everything and its mother is based on manga. However! There are exceptions where the manga was not the basis for the anime. It`s common practice to make manga adaptations of many popular anime, there`s a manga based on Evangelion, and two (one shounen and one shoujo) based on each of Escaflowne and Mahou Tsukai Tai. Also it`s quite common to release manga and anime versions of a story in parallel, for instance Nadesico and Shoujo Kakumei Utena. There are also cases where an anime continues in a manga, as in the case of Angel Beats! and Angel Beats: Heaven`s Door, or reverse. See also http://anidb.net/t6493 [manhua] and http://anidb.net/t5010 [manhwa].

tag.name: technical aspects
tag.description: It may sometimes be useful to know about technical aspects of a show, such as information about its broadcasting or censorship. Such information can be found here.

tag.name: multi-segment episodes
tag.description: Multi-segment episodes are split into several short segments (parts), usually with separate titles and independent storylines. Not to be confused with http://anidb.net/t5852 [short episodes], which are regular episodes that are much shorter than the standard length (up to and including 10 minutes). Also not to be confused with an OVA or music video with multiple (otherwise unrelated) full-length http://anidb.net/t7241 [bundled episodes] consolidated into a single episode video track.

character.name: P-chan
character.description: Ryouga turns into a piglet when he gets into contact with cold water.

episode.title: 愛の歌
Song of Love
Ai no Uta
episode.summary: A spirit who passed away in the Showa era returns, causing trouble all around the neighborhood. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 消えた会費
The Missing Membership Fee
La cotisation disparue
Kieta Kaihi
episode.summary: Rinne`s shinigami union payments go missing. Shirushigami Kain threatens him with late charges. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 夢のコート / 文箱の中
Court of Dreams / Inside the Letter Box
Le court de ses rêves / Le coffret à lettres
Yume no Coat / Fubako no Naka
episode.summary: A spirit is unable to pass on, held back by a desire to play tennis in the school tennis club. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 黒猫 朧
Black Cat Oboro
Le chat noir Oboro
Kuro Neko: Oboro
episode.summary: Ageha doesn`t get along with her black cat contractor, Oboro. They fight. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 思い出発掘 / お金貸して? / キャンプ場の悪魔
Digging Up Memories / Can I Borrow Money? / Demon at the Campground
Omoide Hakkutsu / Okane Kashite? / Camp Ba no Akuma
episode.summary: Rinne`s grandma cleans her house, and digs up some goodies. Rinne`s Dad is broke again. A demon tries to take one of Sakura`s friends` brothers to Hell. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 呪いのワラ人形
The Cursed Straw Doll
Noroi no Wara Ningyou
episode.summary: A spirit is wandering around the steps of a local shrine. She`d died trying to curse Mamiya and Sakura`s homeroom teacher, Suzuki-sensei. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 監督責任
Coaching Responsibilities
Kantoku Sekinin
episode.summary: Masato tricks Rinne`s homestay, Shouma, into turning spirits evil. Both Rinne and Shouma are in deep trouble. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ホームステイ実習
Homestay Trainee
Homestay Jisshuu
episode.summary: Rinne`s homestay, Shouma, is quite a handful. Hoping to end his school assignment quickly, he goes after an evil spirit, but the spirit appears elsewhere as a living human being. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 鎌の事なら三日月堂
Mikazukido for All Your Scythe Needs
Kama no Koto Nara Mikazuki Dou
episode.summary: Rinne`s Shinigami Scythe needs sharpening. He`s invited to Mikazukido, a scythe smith that goes back generations -- but they kind of suck. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 黒猫六段
Black Cat 6th Dan
Kuroneko Rokudan
episode.summary: Rokumon and the other black cats are invited to the celebration of a high-profile black cat before his reincarnation. Meanwhile, Rinne does battle with a hobo moth who threatens to make him even poorer. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 幽霊ゴムボート / トンネルに何かいる / 涅槃家へようこそ!
Ghost Inflatable Boat / Something in the Tunnel / Welcome to Nehan-ya!
Yuurei Gum Boat / Tonneru ni Nanika Iru / Nehan Ie e Youkoso!
episode.summary: Sakura and her friends head to the beach, where they run into Rinne, Ageha, Tsubasa and Rokumon. They investigate a ghost boat, an octopus monster and a section of the beach rumored to be filled with spirits. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 夏祭りの怪
Monsters of the Summer Festival
Natsumatsuri no Kai
episode.summary: It`s summer festival season. Rokudou doesn`t have money to spend on such fun. Instead, he investigates rumors of "Dancing People." Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 謎の転校生
The Mysterious Transfer Student
Nazo no Tenkousei
episode.summary: Shima Renge is a new student at school. She has a habit of breaking people`s hearts -- possibly on purpose. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: れんげの復讐
Renge`s Revenge
Renge no Fukushuu
episode.summary: Shima Renge`s self-imposed community service work hurts Rinne`s weather box business, leaving him terrifyingly poor. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: リカバリークリーム / 噂 / キノコ狩り
Recovery Cream / The Rumor / Mushroom Hunting
Recovery Cream / Uwasa / Kinoko Kari
episode.summary: Mikazukido`s Recovery Cream can fix anything -- including cats. There`s a spirit in the staff storage at school. The black cats go on a trip hunting for magic mushrooms. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 破局セット
Break-up Kit
Hakyoku Set
episode.summary: Ageha tries to break-up Rinne and Sakura with an arsenal of Shinigami tools. Renge gets involved, in an attempt to have it all blow up in Ageha`s face. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 死神小学校同窓会
Shinigami Elementary School Reunion
Shinigami Shougakkou Dousoukai
episode.summary: Demon Masato gets involved his wings stolen by a mysterious man who seems to be trying to lure Rinne into the Shinigami Elementary School reunion. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 黒猫段位テスト
Black Cat Ranking Exam
Kuro Neko Dan`i Test
episode.summary: Rokumon enters the Black Cat Ranking Exam in pursuit of a ranked black cat contractor discount. Kain and Ageha also have their black cat contractors join. Calamity ensues. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 鍋と奉行 / 悪魔A型 死神B型
Hot Pot Conductor / Demon Type A, Shinigami Type B
Nabe to Bugyou / Akuma A Kata Shinigami B Kata
episode.summary: Rokumon`s plan to get the key to the Shinigami door backfires, but he gets his reward. The exam heats up even more. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: MVC
MVC
MVC
episode.summary: Rokumon`s plan to get the key to the Shinigami door backfires, but he gets his reward. The exam heats up even more. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: マフラー, あげます / リンクで待ってる
Have My Scarf / Waiting on the Rink
Muffler, Agemasu / Rink de Matteru
episode.summary: A bossy evil spirit and a bossy Tsubasa nearly crash an oden party Ageha sets up for Rinne. Masato and Rinne are both sick with afterworld strains of influenza. They engage in a glorious coughing battle. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: あの頃のまま...
Never Change...
Ano Koro no Mama...
episode.summary: Renge does everything in her power -- and then some -- to stop her crush, Shirushigami Kain, from finding out that she`s a Damashigami. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 沫悟 再び!?
Matsugo Returns?!
Matsugo Futatabi!?
episode.summary: Ageha tries to put Rinne on a collar. Rinne`s friend from elementary school, Matsugo, is not amused. Sakura, on the other hand, sees an opportunity. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 死神 桜!?
Shinigami Sakura?!
Shinigami Sakura!?
episode.summary: Sakura picks up a scythe that becomes attached to her until she can successfully purify seven spirits. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 桜の賭け
Sakura`s Wager
Sakura no Kake
episode.summary: At their faux date, Sakura overhears Rinne saying he likes her because she feeds him and lends him money. He tries to clear things up with her, but Matsugo has his own ideas. Source: crunchyroll
